ray.surface

Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.surface.Surface
      • ray.surface.Triangle

  • public class Triangle
extends Surface
    A triangle is defined simply by 3 points.
    Author:
    ags

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(Point3 newV0,
                Point3 newV1,
                Point3 newV2,
                Material newMaterial)
        The explicit constructor. This is the only constructor with any real code in it. Values should be set here, and any variables that need to be calculated should be done here.
        Parameters:
        newV0 - The first vertex of the new triangle.
        newV1 - The second vertex of the new triangle.
        newV2 - The third vertex of the new triangle.
        newMaterial - The material of the new triangle.

        public boolean chooseSamplePoint(Point3 p,
                                 Point2 seed,
                                 LuminaireSamplingRecord lRec)
        Description copied from class: Surface
        Choose a random point to sample illumination from this surface as an emitter.
        Specified by:
        chooseSamplePoint in class Surface
        Parameters:
        p - a point where the emitted ray pointing to
        seed - seed used to generate a random point on the surface
        lRec - the output information about the illumination
        Returns:
        true if success

      • intersect

        public boolean intersect(IntersectionRecord outRecord,
                         Ray ray)
        Triangle intersections should be FAST! Generally, most of the time in a ray tracer is spent in this method (as much as 50%). In practice that means that a triangle intersection method should not create any new objects, amd should attempt to perform as little branching as necessary. Also note that you can create as many primitive types in a method as you want. Allociation of primitives is not from the heap and literally takes no time over the cost of calling the method. This is why I can freely allocate so many doubles. The implemented method closely follows the Cramer's rule method described on page 208 of Shirley.
        Specified by:
        intersect in class Surface
        Parameters:
        outRecord - the output IntersectionRecord
        ray - the ray to intersect
        Returns:
        true if the surface intersects the ray
        See Also:
        Surface.intersect(IntersectionRecord, Ray)
